location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 52: Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: Samuel Hennell refers his letter of 22 December 1849 (no. 399), which concerned the sending of Indian Naval Squadron vessels to Mohumrah [Khorramshahr, Iran], to settle the boundary between Turkey and Persia. Hennell encloses a copy of a communication (not included) from Her Majesty's Minister at Tehran, Lieutenant-Colonel Justin Sheil. Hennell states that he has written to Commodore John Patterson Porter, requesting him to proceed to Mohumrah. Hennell also states that he has written to Lieutenant-Colonel Williams, informing him of this arrangement. Hennell encloses copies of these two letters (not included).
